intro: Euphrasia novae-cambriae, commonly known as the California spring beauty, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, early spring blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and mountain meadows. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with five petals and a distinctive yellow throat. Euphrasia novae-cambriae is an herbaceous perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
